text: to one of the main reasons the economy
has gone from shrinking by 6% to growing
at about six percent to one of the main
reasons the economy has gone from
shrinking by six percent to growing at
about six percent Cheryl here we are at
the one-year anniversary of President
Obama's stimulus program he spoke about
it today what struck out what struck you
most about what he said today you know I
think what struck me most was frankly
the sales pitch that he was trying to
make to the American public to say hey
this thing actually worked he said it
created two million jobs which we've
heard him say before he wanted to talk
directly to Americans who don't seem to
think that they got any tax relief from
this bill and he said Americans I want
you to know ninety-five percent of you
pay lower taxes as a result of this bill
he announced fifty new transportation
projects would be funded by the measure
so a little announcement of goodies for
some places around the country that are
interested in high-speed rail or new
port terminals and the like and he tried
to push back against criticism of
Republicans saying that they're all too
eager to vote against the bill as they
rush back home to their districts to
scoop up the money from it well Cheryl
what about the criticism first of all
that that stimulus program just isn't
big enough and what there were in such a
deep hole in terms of jobs in this
country that it just hasn't done enough
he needed to be bolder how does he
address that it's funny he didn't really
address that I mean that's the criticism
that he's getting from the left that
this package should have been bolder and
broader and it would have done more to
help the economy you really don't hear
that critique that much in the political
discourse here in Washington anymore
with so much concern about the national
debt and the deficit the bigger critique
of the Obama plan is the one Republicans
put forward which is that it hasn't
created any new jobs that look we've
still got nine point seven percent
unemployment and many many Americans are
out of work and hurting so how can the
administration say this has created jobs
and the White House's response and
President Obama's argument is like his
look hey things would have been worse if
we hadn't done this now Cheryl I know
your report you're doing a lot of
reporting around the sub
you're going to get well beyond his
remarks and even the back-and-forth
criticism we here in Washington so
what's your assessment of whether this
is working and whether this was a good
idea well i think you know it's it's
difficult to know because obviously we
don't know we don't have a comparison we
don't know what would have happened in
the absence of this bill but most
economists most mainstream economists
say that this was the necessary step
that had to be taken to save the economy
from the next Great Depression
